Great game, a lot of fun and i really love playing it! The only problem I have is the camping and tunnling. I know its a hard thing to battle and fix but having a Perk like insidious doesnt really help the case. The killer and survivor balance is definitely tricky, but it is a great game and I can't recommend it enough!

What can I say, I started playing Dead by Daylight in early 2018, back then, the game was great, new characters, all with unique powers and perks, new maps, the game was constantly giving us new updates, that actually changed some things and added new interesting  stuff. As a huge fan of horror/slashers movies/games that was amazing to play both as a survivor and the killer. Thanks to this game i've made couple of friends with similar hobbies and spend a lot of good times in it. DBD offered a few amazing events each one of 4 quarters of the year, like: Lunar(Chinese new year), Scorching Summer BBQ(Summer), Hallowed Blight(Halloween)  and Winter Solstice(Winter), we've spent a lot of good time trying to complete each of these and earn limited skins. Everything was great, until 2020. The game flooded us with new characters and perks that were very similar to the already existing ones. They stopped adding new maps (with a few exceptions), got rid of events (except halloween and boring anniversary), the game balance has become chaotic, either you play with what is in the meta or you are doomed to fail, not mentioning about matchmaking which was awful and broken. This is the reason why the game become monotonous and boring. And for some reason, they started adding more and more characters based on anime or other series(like trickster and Mikaela) that attract the community of 14 year old girls, and as I've mentioned before, as a horror/slashers fan I've felt disgusted in which way this game was going. One more word about the skins, as I said before there aren't too many events, but they still trying to make some money out of it, they add a lot of event themed skins, but you can't unlock them for free as it was in 2018, you have to purchase it(and a lot of this skins aren't even worth theire prize). Finally, the things that have always been present in the game: toxic community, a lot of bugs, and a repetitive game model, and now there are also devs, who do nothing but taking money out of whatever they can. So, if you want to waste money go ahead, but if you don't want to lose your nerves and cash, you should stay away from this game.

If you are a competitive person like me, this game is not for you.
Game is balanced around low level play, so if you want to play at high MMR you are very limited on what killers you can play since the majority of the killer roster sucks.
If you are a survivor main and decent/good at the game, be ready to see nothing but Blight and Nurse all day long.
MMR is not the problem like people say it is, it's the fact the balance fucking sucks and lower tier killers never get the love they deserve.

This is one of those games where you can develop a love/hate relationship with it. On the one hand, DBD can be extremely fun and offer an experience pretty much no other asymmetrical PVP game is offering right now, with iconic horror characters no less. On the other hand, matchmaking and game balance is absolutely terrible at times. (Albeit matchmaking has noticeably improved, at least for me, in recent weeks.) In addition, the community can be very toxic, adding to any ire you may feel towards the game already. Despite the major issues it does have, I love the game and I very much want to see it improve and expand in the future. It has a good core to it, and I can see how it could expand and grow beyond these issues. Overall, I would definitely recommend it, especially if you get it on sale with DLC.

I enjoy playing DBD both Survivor & Killer, but I will recommend if you are new to DBD and want to play survivor, you will want to play it with your friends. If you don't play it with your friends and are playing it solo be prepared to die a lot until you understand how to play it correctly. There are safe loops and unsafe loops and so on, that will only come in time by playing  the game and learning the plays and perks of killers and survivors.

The game would be massively improved if the survivors had more options to enhance their chances of escape. The ability to fight back would be one example of this - and fighting back doesn't mean killing the killer or turning DBD into something that betrays its identity. I understand the purpose and the power of The Entity, but it's unrealistic that a survivor couldn't, for example, swing a board at a killer to temporarily stun them. Timed actions, perhaps like parrying in ARPGs, are one potential way to implement such a feature. 
It isn't as much about the power imbalance between survivors and killers as it is the lack of realistic, intuitive, and reasonable means of self defense. 

An argument I keep seeing against this is that The Entity could, for example, just sap the power away from a survivor to keep them from fighting back. If that's the case, then why doesn't The Entity just sap the energy from a survivor when they are attempting to flee through one of the gates? 

The game could also be improved by adding more ways for the survivors to hide or flee. This change could mean providing more options for creativity when it comes to either fleeing or attempting to conceal oneself from the killer. An increase in options for survivors wouldn't take away from the fact that killers have an abundance of tools at their disposal to locate and destroy survivors. It would, however, reward survivors for creativity and ingenuity. It would also make playing as a survivor - particularly when one plays without a premade party - a much more varied, dynamic, engaging, and (subjectively) fun experience. 

A final change that I would personally enjoy, but that I wouldn't say the game *needs*, is providing survivors with something active to do after they die. If one dies early on in a long match, they have to - potentially - sit around for frustratingly lengthy periods of time as passive observers. This can get incredibly dull, especially the more matches one plays. Perhaps downed survivors could sent to some realm where they can fight to free their souls from The Entity's grasp. Doing so might afford survivors the chance to gain some points. It could also give survivors the chance to resurrect, but I can see how that change might upset some with more conservative attitudes towards this game. A potential compromise in such a situation would be limiting the amount of health survivors have upon returning, as well as limiting the amount of potential respawns (I'd make it 1) that they could recieve. 

This game has its good points and I sometimes enjoy playing it, but as it stands, I can't recommend it unless improvements are made.
